creditline: Gift of George W. Rickey in memory of Edith L. Rickey
description: comb topped with central standing figure, PL hand on hip, holding a very long rifle (?); figure flanked by pair of heads on ringed necks topped with blocks; area above teeth carved with geometric designs and a bird
inscription: \"R85-117E\", in black, on back of PR end tooth
text: Hairstyles have long reflected personal aesthetics in African and African-American cultures. And when adorned with extensions, beads, pins, or combs, they can indicate a person’s status, ethnic origin, gender, profession, or even what phase of life they’re in. These three combs, from West and Central Africa, show how African artists turn even everyday objects into accomplished carvings.
title: Comb
